Looking at the code, it is easy to oversee that either `terminating` is written for the child instance or `terminated` for the call activity. Maybe, we can improve it a bit.

```suggestion
    stateBehavior
        .getCalledChildInstance(containerContext)
        .filter(ElementInstance::canTerminate)
        .map(instance -> context.copy(instance.getKey(), instance.getValue(), instance.getState()))
        .ifPresentOrElse(
          childInstanceContext -> transitionToTerminating(childInstanceContext), 
          () -> transitionToTerminated(containerContext));
```

Looking at the code, it is easy to oversee that either terminating is written for the child instance or terminated for the call activity. Maybe, we can improve it a bit.

Suggested change
public void terminateChildProcessInstance(final BpmnElementContext context) {
stateBehavior
.getCalledChildInstance(context)
.filter(ElementInstance::canTerminate)
.map(instance -> context.copy(instance.getKey(), instance.getValue(), instance.getState()))
.ifPresentOrElse(this::transitionToTerminating, () -> transitionToTerminated(context));
public void terminateChildProcessInstance(final BpmnElementContext containerContext) {
stateBehavior
.getCalledChildInstance(containerContext)
.filter(ElementInstance::canTerminate)
.map(instance -> context.copy(instance.getKey(), instance.getValue(), instance.getState()))
.ifPresentOrElse(
childInstanceContext -> transitionToTerminating(childInstanceContext),
() -> transitionToTerminated(containerContext));
